Fever
A healthy body maintains its temperature within a narrow range of 37.00C and 
37.70C.  Fever means there is an increase in the normal temperature. During 
common ailments such as cold, a person may develop mild fever. This is not a 
cause for worry as the fever usually goes away as the cold gets better. 
Fever is graded as:
✱  Mild: Temperature (37.80C – 38.00C).
✱  Moderate: Temperature (38.10C – 39.00C).
✱  High: Temperature above 39.10C.
It is sometimes accompanied by rashes as in measles, dengue and chicken pox. 
Infection in any part of the body can also cause fever as in the case of sore throat, bronchitis, pneumonia, urinary tract infection, and so on.
